meanings.definition: Of or relating to the present or recent times.
meanings.sent1: The car had a sleek, modern design.
meanings.sent2: She prefers modern art over classical paintings.
meanings.sent3: In a modern twist, the cat walked on its hind legs.
meanings.sent4: His ideas were too modern for the conservative group.
meanings.sent5: The modern skyscraper towered over the old buildings.

meanings.definition: Characterized by or using the latest technology, ideas, or styles.
meanings.sent1: The smartphone is a modern device that can do many things.
meanings.sent2: The modern kitchen is equipped with all the latest appliances.
meanings.sent3: The robot made a modern mistake by trying to cook dinner.
meanings.sent4: Her modern approach to fashion always turns heads.
meanings.sent5: The modern computer revolutionized the way we work.

meanings.definition: A person who advocates or practices a departure from traditional styles or values.
meanings.sent1: As a modern, she challenged the old ways of thinking.
meanings.sent2: The moderns in the group pushed for innovative solutions.
meanings.sent3: The modern at the party wore a top hat and sunglasses.
meanings.sent4: He was considered a modern in the world of classical music.
meanings.sent5: The moderns brought fresh perspectives to the discussion.
